task.title: Manage Elastic IP Addresses
task.shortdesc: Your Eucalyptus cloud can offer elastic IP addresses that you can associate with your running instances. This screen allows you to view a list of your available elastic IP addresses, allocate new elastic IP addresses, associate and disassociate elastic IP addresses with running instances, and release elastic IP addresses. You can page through the list of elastic IP addresses by clicking the navigation buttons at the bottom of the screen.

step.cmd: Click on any column header to toggle sorting the list of IP addresses in ascending or descending order by the selected column.
Type some search text into the Search text box to filter the list of IP addresses.
Click the Allocate new IP address button. The Allocate IP Addresses dialog box will appear.

task.title: Attach an IP Address to a Running Instance

step.cmd: Select an unassociated IP address from the Manage IP Addresses window.
Click the More actions link at the top of the screen and select Associate to instance from the context menu.

info.note: You can also right-click the unassociated IP address and select Associate to instance from the context menu.

step.info: The Assocate IP Address to instance dialog appears.

task.title: Disassociate an IP Address from a Running Instance

step.cmd: Right-click on the attached IP address you wish to disassociate from a running instance.
Select Disassociate from instance from the context menu. The Release IP addresses to cloud dialog box will appear.

info.note: You can also click on an associate IP address and select Disassociate from instance item from the More actions menu link at the top of the list.

step.cmd: Select one or more unassociated IP addresses from the list.
Right-click in the volume list and select Release to cloud from the context menu. The Release IP addresses to cloud dialog box will appear.

info.note: You can also select the IP addresses to release and select Release to cloud item from the More actions menu link at the top of the list.
